author: Subhajit Ganguly

resources.description: The dataset refers to Ambient Water Quality of Aquatic Resources in India for 2011. The minimum, maximum and mean values of water quality parameters like Temperature, Dissolved Oxygen(D.O.), ph, Conductivity, Biochemical Oxygen Demand(B.O.D), Nitrate-N and Nitrite-N, Fecal Coliform, Total Coliform, Fluoride(particularly for Ground water) are given in the dataset. The water quality monitoring network comprises of 2500 stations in 28 States and 6 Union Territories. Monitoring network covers 445 Rivers, 154 Lakes, 12 Tanks, 78 Ponds, 41 Creeks/Seawater, 25 Canals, 45 Drains, 10 Water Treatment Plant (Raw Water) and 807 Wells. The data is sourced from "Status of Water quality in India-2011".
resources.name: Status of Water Quality in India-2011

organization.description:
India specific data
For visualizations, please visit: http://in.okfn.org/visualized-data/
organization.title: India Data
organization.name: india
